required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Serum Progesterone Levels on the Day of Frozen Embryo Transfer (FET) and Pregnancy Outcomes
clinical_study.official_title: Serum Progesterone Levels on the Day of Frozen Embryo Transfer (FET) and Pregnancy Outcomes

brief_summary.textblock: Frozen embryo transfer (FET) cycles have become more common in recent years due to a push towards elective single embryo transfer (SET). While it is known that progesterone supplementation during the luteal phase improves clinical pregnancy rates, there is a paucity of prospective data on the impact of serum progesterone levels on pregnancy outcomes in FET cycles. This multicentre prospective cohort study aims to investigate the association between serum progesterone levels on the day of FET and pregnancy outcomes, and to determine a serum progesterone cut-off value above which clinical pregnancy and live birth are more likely to occur. Women undergoing ART-FET cycles at CARE Fertility clinics in the UK will be recruited and their serum progesterone measured on the day of frozen embryo transfer. Follow-up data will be stored in electronic patient records and analysed to determine whether a low serum progesterone level on the day of FET adversely affects ART outcomes.

primary_outcome.description: Birth of a live fetus at 24 or more weeks of gestational age

secondary_outcome.description: Any clinical pregnancy lost before week 12 of gestation per participant (number of events/number of participants, %)
Number of gestational sacs seen in a 2D transvaginal ultrasound scan divided by the number of embryos transferred per patient (number of events/number of embryos transferred, %)
Positive pregnancy test following embryo transfer per participant (number of events/number of participants, %)
Presence of at least one gestational sac on ultrasound (number of events/number of participants, %)

intervention.intervention_name: Measurement of serum progesterone on the day of FET
intervention.description: Measurement of serum progesterone on the day of FET

biospec_descr.textblock: Serum progesterone will be measured from consenting participants on the day of frozen embryo transfer.

study_pop.textblock: All women undergoing ART with FET.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All women undergoing ART with FET.
Exclusion Criteria:
- None. We aim to study the "every day" patient undergoing FET, and for this we intend to keep the population of the study as unselected as possible.

patient_data.ipd_description: No IPD will be shared with other researchers. Any IPD will be confined to the purposes of the study.
